page.title: 18PARISH NEWSLETTER
page.content: Dear Friends, People tell ypu that moving house is one of the most traumatic experiences anyone can have, and they're right.Having gone through the experience yet again i can say without any doubt that it is a tiring and wearing thing.To see all one's treasures packed away in boxes and one's furniture manhandled up and down stairs andin and out of vans is somewhat unnerving but it also makes one realise how much baggage we now think necessary for civilised living to go on. When I was involved in settling some Vietnamese families in homes in Flint we were struck by how little they had in materizl possessions.Two suitcases and the inevitable radio-cassette per family seemed pitifully small....Part of the Tremeirchion Newsletter,September 1985
